snippet: The council of the Borough of Tower Hamlets in the East End of London is expected to decide on Wednesday whether it will sell a Henry Moore sculpture despite opposition from art-world figures, who say the sale “goes against the spirit of Henry...
abstract: The council of the Borough of Tower Hamlets in the East End of London is expected to decide on Wednesday whether it will sell a Henry Moore sculpture despite opposition from art-world figures, who say the sale “goes against the spirit of Henry Moore’s original sale” of the work.
lead_paragraph: The council of the Borough of Tower Hamlets in the East End of London is expected to decide on Wednesday whether it will sell a Henry Moore sculpture despite opposition from Sir Nicholas Serota, director of the Tate; Danny Boyle, the filmmaker; and artists including Jeremy Deller, who have signed an open letter saying that the sale “goes against the spirit of Henry Moore’s original sale” of the work.

headline.main: British Art World Figures Protest Possible Sale of a Henry Moore
